etymology.description: Ideogrammic: 軎 (“axle tip”) + 殳 (“weapon”) — things which hit each other.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the image of an axle tip and a striking implement to depict impact. By association, it denotes ramming or knocking against something.

examples.chinese: 司机不小心把车毄在墙上(司機不小心把車毄在牆上)。
examples.pinyin: Sījī bù xiǎoxīn bǎ chē jī zài qiáng shàng.
examples.english: The driver accidentally rammed the car into the wall.

examples.chinese: 战车用车头去毄敌人的城门(戰車用車頭去毄敵人的城門)。
examples.pinyin: Zhànchē yòng chētóu qù jī dírén de chéngmén.
examples.english: The chariot used its front to ram the enemy’s city gate.

examples.chinese: 小孩拿石头毄门(小孩拿石頭毄門)，发出很响的声音(發出很響的聲音)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎohái ná shítou jī mén, fāchū hěn xiǎng de shēngyīn.
examples.english: The child knocked the door with a stone, producing a loud sound.
